item.title: 1.1: Introduction to Public Economics
item.description: Contents Overview Readings for Discussion Slides Wednesday, January 15, 2020 Overview This introduction will give an overview of the course and the topics that we will cover. A primary question we will address this semester is how do we choose in groups? Readings for Discussion There are no readings assigned for today’s class, but see the required readings (and email questions) for discussion for next class.

item.title: 3.1: Voting I: Preference Aggregation & Cycling
item.description: Contents Appendix: Spatial Competition in Multiple-Dimensions Appendix: Spatial Competition in Multiple-Dimensions In class, we looked at spatial competition along a single dimension, and saw that if preferences are single-peaked, the median platform will win a majority, and escape the problem of cycling. Suppose we have three voters again voting on a platform of two issues: (1) Education Spending and (2) Defense Spending. We represent their ideal points in 2-dimensional issue space in the figure above.
